pullRequest.title: [KOGITO-783] [KOGITO-786] Quarkus/Spring Boot archetypes - provide Swagger OpenApi on the confi…
pullRequest.bodyText:
KOGITO-783, KOGITO-786

Enable Swagger-UI on Quarkus Archetype
Fix URL for OpenAPI specification "/docs/openapi.json" updating the README
Inserting application.properties
Fix Process ID to test instead of default
Fix process package on the archetype to be replaced according to the project package (was empty before)
Using the same process for SpringBoot and Quarkus

nodes.bodyText: would prefer something more creative than test, but not sure perhaps, kogito or myprocess??
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@
 Generated application comes with sample test process that allows you to verify if the application is working as expected. Simply execute following command to try it out
 
 ```sh
-curl -d '{}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST http://localhost:8080/tests                                                                                                    
+curl -d '{}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST http://localhost:8080/test

nodes.bodyText: with the backslashes the oneliner should not be necessary
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,18 +1,18 @@
 # Generate KaaS project based on Quarkus runtime
 
-To generate new project for KaaS (Kjar as a Service) based on Quarkus use following command
+To generate new project for KaaS (Kjar as a Service) based on [Quarkus](https://quarkus.io/) use following command
 
     ```
-     mvn archetype:generate 
-    -DarchetypeGroupId=org.kie.kogito
-    -DarchetypeArtifactId=kogito-quarkus-archetype
-    -DarchetypeVersion=8.0.0-SNAPSHOT 
-    -DgroupId=com.company 
-    -DartifactId=sample-kogito     
+     mvn archetype:generate \
+    -DarchetypeGroupId=org.kie.kogito \
+    -DarchetypeArtifactId=kogito-quarkus-archetype \
+    -DarchetypeVersion=8.0.0-SNAPSHOT \
+    -DgroupId=com.company \
+    -DartifactId=sample-kogito
     ```
 
 or cut/paste this one-liner
 
     ```
-     mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeGroupId=org.kie.kogito -DarchetypeArtifactId=kogito-quarkus-archetype -DarchetypeVersion=8.0.0-SNAPSHOT -DgroupId=com.company -DartifactId=sample-kogito     
+     mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeGroupId=org.kie.kogito -DarchetypeArtifactId=kogito-quarkus-archetype -DarchetypeVersion=8.0.0-SNAPSHOT -DgroupId=com.company -DartifactId=sample-kogito

commit.message:
Quarkus/Spring Boot archetypes - provide Swagger OpenApi on the configured path, enable Swagger-UI, fiz README, inserintg application.properties, Fix process ID to test

Changing sample process id to greetings, apply other PR comments

beforeCommit.message: Quarkus/Spring Boot archetypes - provide Swagger OpenApi on the configured path, enable Swagger-UI, fiz README, inserintg application.properties, Fix process ID to test

afterCommit.message:
Quarkus/Spring Boot archetypes - provide Swagger OpenApi on the configured path, enable Swagger-UI, fiz README, inserintg application.properties, Fix process ID to test

Changing sample process id to greetings, apply other PR comments

nodes.bodyText: @cristianonicolai / @tiagodolphine just a question about this property. What is the difference between this and server.servlet.context-path? Won't it map all application endpoints to /docs?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,8 @@
 server.address=0.0.0.0
 
+#static content generated by swagger-maven-plugin
 spring.mvc.servlet.path=/docs
